result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Nicholas A Piette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Successfully complete probation on other counts and Count 1 will be dismissed.
Cash bail applied to costs.  Costs paid in full.

No contact with: victim or her residence and victim's family.  Defendant to work with agent and write a letter of apology to victim.  Sex offender probation and treatment.  Defendant to register as a sex offender with City of Muskego Police Department during period of probation.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained.  
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Huber.  Non-working hours.  Sentence commencing forthwith.

records.addlTxt: From defendant dated 4/5/17 requesting modification of sentence. (Received voicemail from Atty Cotton 4/13/17 that defendant rescinds correspondence.)

ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas A Piette
Current: 1400 Northview Rd., c/o Waukesha County Huber, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 04-13-2017)
Prior: S77w17857 St Leonards Ct, Muskego, WI 53150
Character letter filed by Atty Cotton.
Sentencing recommendation received on 10/10/16 and filed by Attorney Cotton with attached character reference letters
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered received on 10/10/16 and filed by Attorney Cotton.

Defendant Nicholas A Piette in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State presented plea agreement to the court. Attorney Cotton presented statements as to the plea agreement. State filed Amended Information.
Defendant entered a plea of guilty to Counts 1 through 4 of the Amended Information. Court conducted plea colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant guilty of Counts 2 through 4 and withheld entry of judgment on Count 1.
Denise P. presented statements on behalf of victim.
David and Joan P. presented statements on behalf of defendant. 
 

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count 1 - Defendant entered into a deferred prosecution agreement. If defendant successfully completes probation on counts 2, 3 and 4, then count 1 will be dismissed.   

Counts 2 - 4

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

9 MONTHS JAIL EACH COUNT, CONSECUTIVE; 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  

*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No contact with:  victim or her residence and victim's family; 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Sex offender probation and treatment.
*Defendant to register as a sex offender with City of Muskego Police Department during period of probation.
*Defendant to work with agent and write a letter of apology to victim.


COURT COSTS:  $243.00 for counts 2-4, totaling $729.00 to be paid as a condition of probation; Apply cash bail

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 each count, totals $600.00 to be paid as a condition of probation); Apply cash bail, refund balance to poster. 

CONDITION TIME:  4 months each count, consecutive, with Huber (non-working hours) commencing forthwith. Defendant remanded to the Sheriff's Department.  

Defendant will not seek Expunction. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given as part of the deferred prosecution agreement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Per Judge Aprahamian jury trial to be removed from calendar and the case to be scheduled for plea and sentencing on 10/11/16 at 9:00 a.m.

CD's (2) stored in record center.

Exhibits 1 and 2
(scanned)

Defendant Nicholas A Piette in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the matter to address the motion to suppress filed by Attorney Cotton.  The State calls Officer Matthew Curran with the City of Muskego Police Department, the witness is sworn in and the State conducts direct examination of the witness.   Exhibit 1 and 2 are marked.   Cross examination by Attorney Cotton.  Redirect by the State. The witness is excused.  The State offers Exhibits 1 and 2 and the Court received and admits the exhibits into evidence.  The Court will take the motion under advisement and render a written decision prior to the next hearing. The State to provide the Court with disc of interview.  Attorney Szczupakiewicz will try to file the disc by the end of the day.  Hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.
